info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 6 at 4:41PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
At 441 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Las Cruces, moving southeast at 20 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Leasburg, Las Cruces, Radium Springs, NMSU Main Campus, Dona Ana, Mesilla, Fairacres, Talavera, East Mesa, San Pablo, Picacho, Hill, Northeast Las Cruces, Corralitos, Las Cruces West Mesa, Southern New Mexico State Fairgrounds, Dripping Springs, Mesilla Valley Bosque State Park, Soledad Canyon, and Portions of Organ Mountains Desert Peaks National Monument.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 121 and 145. Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 17. Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 150 and 157.
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
